# spawn.prim.sh

> VPS for agents. Provision, manage, and destroy virtual machines via API.

Base URL: https://spawn.prim.sh
Auth: x402 (USDC on Base Sepolia)

## Endpoints

### Servers

- `POST /v1/servers` — create a server. **$0.01**
- `GET /v1/servers` — list servers. **$0.001**
- `GET /v1/servers/:id` — get server details (status, IP). **$0.001**
- `DELETE /v1/servers/:id` — delete a server. **$0.005**
- `POST /v1/servers/:id/start` — start a stopped server. **$0.002**
- `POST /v1/servers/:id/stop` — stop a running server. **$0.002**
- `POST /v1/servers/:id/reboot` — reboot a server. **$0.002**
- `POST /v1/servers/:id/resize` — resize a server. **$0.01**
- `POST /v1/servers/:id/rebuild` — rebuild from image. **$0.005**

### SSH Keys

- `POST /v1/ssh-keys` — register an SSH key. **$0.001**
- `GET /v1/ssh-keys` — list SSH keys. **$0.001**
- `DELETE /v1/ssh-keys/:id` — delete an SSH key. **$0.001**

## Limits (beta)

- 3 concurrent servers per wallet
- `small` type only (1 vCPU, 1 GB RAM)

## Examples

```bash
# Register an SSH key
curl -X POST https://spawn.prim.sh/v1/ssh-keys \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"name": "my-key", "public_key": "ssh-ed25519 AAAA..."}'

# Create a server
curl -X POST https://spawn.prim.sh/v1/servers \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"name": "my-server", "type": "small", "image": "ubuntu-24.04", "location": "nyc3", "ssh_keys": ["KEY_ID"]}'

# Check server status (poll until status=active to get IP)
curl https://spawn.prim.sh/v1/servers/SERVER_ID
```
